title: Missoula Training Race
description: Annual Missoula/Clinton Training Race. Non-competitive event to kick off the Montana road racing season.
course: Mostly flat with a couple of very mellow hills.  The course is about a six mile circuit.  The course will be open to traffic so please obey the center line rule. Early season road conditions (Potholes) exist on road.
registration: Missoula Bicycle Works - registration opens at 9:00am and closes at 11:00am
notes: Temps below 35 degrees or below 45 degrees and rain will result in cancellation of the race.  We will broadcast cancellations early.
directions: Race parking is 20 miles east of Missoula at the Clinton exit.  Park on road north of railroad track.  Park on the south side of the road (side nearest track).

title: Gallatin Valley Bicycle Club Training Ride Series
Herron Park XC Race
registration:
On site registration only - 8:00AM-9:30 AM
For more info go to: http://www.montanacycling.net/schedule/2011
notes: $1000.00 in prize money for Pro/Cat 1s and 2s, men and women, kids race 9:30 AM.  Juniors and kids race free.
directions: HWY 93 to Rocky Cliff Rd. (south of Kalispell), Rocky Cliff to Airport Rd. (ends there), turn left on Airport Rd. (turns into Foys Canyon Rd) and go about 2.5 miles to Herron Park.

title: 2011 Great Northern Stage Race - Presented by Don
flyer_url: 2011 Great Northern Stage Race - Presented by Don.pdf
description: 2011 Great Northern Stage Race is a multi-day three-stage race timed event consisting of a Criterium, Time Trial, and Circuit Race.
course:
Criterium: Course is a 0.87-mile closed loop around downtown Whitefish. Roads are flat and fast with wind protection provided by downtown buildings and homes. Start and finish will be at Depot Park. The Criterium stage of the 2011 Great Northern Stage Race is the Montana State Criterium Championships for 2011 and participation in the Criterium only will be allowed. Riders participating only in the Criterium stage, however, will not be eligible to compete for cash and prizes that are available, and listed below, for the overall General Classification. Criterium stage (or Criterium-only) awards will be posted on race day.

Time Trial: Course is a 4.85-mile hill climb up Big Mountain Road gaining 1,562 feet in elevation. The road climbs consistently from the beginning with an average grade of 6.2%.  The start will be at the intersection of East Lakeshore Drive and Big Mountain Road and the finish is in the Village at the end of Big Mountain Road. Riders will start in 30 second intervals in the order of their bib numbers of their respective race classification and in the same order as the morning’s Criterium. Start times will be posted following final results for the Criterium. It is the rider’s responsibility to be present for his/her start time. Racers should sign in with the starting official, or organizer, and seed themselves along the bike path prior to their start time. Bib numbers will be called in the official starting order prior to each riders start time. 

Circuit Race: Course is primarily a 6.6-mile relatively flat to rolling loop on Lodgepole, Farm-to-Market, and Twin Bridges roads west of Whitefish with a finish climb up Star Meadows Road. Staging will be at the Olney-Bissell school on Farm-to-Market Road.  From Whitefish, head west/north for about 4.5 miles on Highway 93 to Twin Bridges road. Turn left on Twin Bridges Road to the race loop as it turns into Lodgepole, turn right continuing on Twin Bridges to the intersection of Farm-to-Market, turn left on FTM and drive around the race loop to Olney Bissell School.
registration: Pre-register fee for the Stage Race is $75.00 (Juniors are eligible for $1 day-of registration) which includes free dinner Saturday night and commemorative race goodies. Since this event is primarily a Stage Race, registration for individual stages is not allowed with the exception of the Criterium. Criterium only pre-registration is $30. Pre registration is encouraged. Links to registration forms and online registration will be posted at http://fvbr.wordpress.com/ Unlicensed riders (cat 5 men cat 4 women) will have an additional $5 fee. Field Size Limit 50 riders per category. Race Day registration is $85 for all three stages and $35 for Criterium only. On site registration opens 1.5 hours prior to posted start times and closes 15 min prior to Criterium start time. Sign-in only for the Circuit race will be located at Olney-Bissell School. Team directors of four or more racers should contact the Race Director for team pricing.
notes: See http://fvbr.wordpress.com for additional race information.
directions: Directions, Race-day Registration, Parking, and Warming-up: Follow MT-93 north to Whitefish and proceed north on Spokane until the road intersects with Railway Avenue at Depot Park. Maps to each area can be found at http://fvbr.wordpress.com/. Registration for the Criterium only and the Stage Race will be located at Depot Park. Criterium parking is on City streets or in one of the City parking lots. Do not warm up on the Criterium course until cleared to do so by the Chief Referee. Time Trial Parking is either at the Ice Rink on Wisconsin Avenue, or at the finish line at Whitefish Mountain Resort. Please do not park at the starting area!! Warm up for the time trail along Lakeshore road past the starting area. Road Race Parking is at Olney-Bissell School parking lot and secondary parking lot on the West side of Farm-to-Market Road. Warming up on the course will be allowed up to 15 minutes before the first flight, otherwise warm up on Farm to Market Road north of the course.

title: Kettle House Weekday Race League Series
flyer_url: Kettle House Weekday Race League Series.pdf
description:
Training Series for folks to get ready for the Missoula XC in late July! Three ways to go: 1 lap/2 laps/3 laps
Each lap is 6km in length with approx. 900 vertical per lap.
Ice Cream from Big Dipper and other food will be available!
course: The course is being designed and constructed specifically for the Pro XCT event in late July, and will reflect the contemporary World Cup course template. Steep, technical climbs and descents will alternate between single track, double track, and infrequent dirt road sections. Frequent and sudden rhythm changes will challenge racers, but several sequences of fast and fun sections will be included as well. The course features over 900 feet (275 m) of relief per lap; while it is not at extremely high altitude, multiple long, steep climbs per lap will test racers’ fitness limits.  Course maps and elevation profiles can be found on the race website.
registration: Register on-line or on site. Promoter strongly recommends registering on-line. All riders must have a current USA Cycling license or a one day permit which is NOT reflected in the registration fee.
notes: All participants will be started at the time in waves. Beginning riders will go one lap, more advanced 2 laps, advanced rides will go laps. Pick your poison, but beware sandbaggers will be \"outed\"!! Build your skills and come have fun!
directions: Located at Marshall Mountain 7 miles from downtown Missoula.  From the Van Buren I90 exit take East Broadway towards East Missoula.  East Broadway is also called Highway 200.  Follow East Broadway/Hwy 200 for roughly 3.6 miles.  Turn left onto Marshall Canyon Road (There will be a Marshall Resort Sign).  Take Marshall Canyon Road for 2.7 miles.  Parking is in the lot past the gate.

title: Philipsburg Speedweek
description: A weekend of speed.  Four Omnium scored time trial events.  40K TT is the Montana State TT Championships.
course:
40K Time Trial - Starts at the Sunshine Station, goes  20K North on rolling downhill and returns to finish just prior to the sunshine Station.
300M Street Sprints on slight uphill in downtown Philipsburg.
Killermeter (tentatively) on the Philipsburg airfield.
Hill Climb: 3 miles 6-7% up Flint Creek Pass to Georgetown Lake.
registration: Preregistration is prefered.  There will be a $10 fee for on-site registration at the Sunshine Station on Saturday, 2 July from 8-9am and the Philipsburg airport on Sunday, 3 July from 8-9am.  There will be no on-site registration at the Street Sprints or the Hill Climb.
notes: Only Annually Licensed Racers are eligible for State Championship medals.  One-day licensees can compete for bragging rights.  Riders must compete in all four events to compete for the overall awards.  Overall awards will go through the top five places, depending on field size.
directions:
From Missoula: Take I90, Exit 153, south 26 miles to the Sunshine Station on the MT 1, east side of the road.
From Butte:  Take I90, Exit 208, north 38 miles.

title: Beartooth Ride
description: 24 mile Hill Climb Time Trial up the Beartooth Pass in Red Lodge Montana.
course: 24 mile Time Trail with over 5000 vertical feet of climbing up to over 10,000 feet.
notes: Deemed “Seasonal Indulgence” by the Travel Channel, the Beartooth Pass boasts one of the most beautiful scenic road in the nation—this race takes place right in the heart of it.  This 25 mile hill climb starts at the foothills of the pass, giving you a chance to warm up and feel how intense the winds can be in the canyons.  Then the climb starts up the steep switchbacks, where breadth-taking scenery awaits.  After the switchbacks, the plateau can be either a beautiful serene alpine setting, or brutal cross winds in the summertime.  The race will finish at one of the highest lift served ski area in the nation.  Awards will be held in Red Lodge with great prizes and food.
directions: Head south 8 miles of Red Lodge Montana to the Rock Creek Resort located on Highway 212.

title: Montana MS/HS Scholastic MTB State Champs
Missoula Cyclocross series
registration: On-site registration only. $6 per race, $35 for the series. Juniors $6 per race, $15 for the series. USA Cycling license required. One-day licenses are available for $10.
directions: Ft. Missoula, near the Historical Museum at Ft. Missoula

title: MSU Cyclocross Weekend
description: Come on down for a fun-filled weekend of cyclocross, presented to you by the Montana State University Cycling Team.
course: The same great course as last year. East Gallatin Rec Area has something for beginners and veterans alike with sand pits, grass, dirt, trail, a beach, and fun natural. The course will be modified Saturday to Sunday.
registration: Online registration is strongly encouraged. $20 for individual races, and $35 for both days if registering onling. $25 for individuals and $40 for both days if registering on-sitre. Juniors race for free. Registration opens 2 hours prior to the start of the first race and closes 15 minutes prior to posted start times.
directions:
Traveling East on Interstate 90 - Take Exit 306, turn left onto North 7th Avenue. Take 2nd right onto W. Griffin Drive. Take 3rd Left on Manley Road. Go 0.6 miles, East Gallatin Rec Area access is on your right.

Traveling West on Interstate 90- Take Exit 306, turn right onto North 7th Avenue. Take 2nd right onto W. Griffin Drive. Take 3rd Left on Manley Road. Go 0.6 miles, East Gallatin Rec Area access is on your right.
